column1: Smoque BBQ////Best BBQ I've had in Chicago. Had the sliced beef brisket and a link of the Texas sausage. As great as the brisket was
column2: the sausage was perhaps even better. I also tried a taste of the St. Louis ribs from a friend's plate
column4: with a great rub and sauce
column5: and the meat slid right off the bone. The BBQ beans were an excellent side choice
column6: as was the mac & cheese. The cole slaw was not to my liking
column7: as I prefer a creamier base; theirs is in a vinegar base. Lines were long
column8: but were worth the wait. Would highly recommend this place
column9: just expect a long wait during peak times.
